messages.content: A bookstore sells fiction and non-fiction books. On Monday, they sold 45 fiction books and 30 non-fiction books. On Tuesday, they sold twice as many fiction books as Monday, but only half as many non-fiction books. How many total books did they sell over both days?
If a train travels at 60 mph for 2 hours, then 80 mph for 1.5 hours, what is the total distance traveled and the average speed for the entire journey?
A rectangular garden has a perimeter of 56 meters. If the length is 4 meters more than the width, what are the dimensions of the garden and its area?
Three friends split a restaurant bill. The total was $87.50 plus 18% tip. If they split everything equally, how much does each person pay?
A company's revenue grew by 15% in Year 1, then decreased by 10% in Year 2. If the initial revenue was $1,000,000, what is the revenue at the end of Year 2?
If it takes 5 machines 5 minutes to make 5 widgets, how long would it take 100 machines to make 100 widgets?
A water tank is being filled at a rate of 3 gallons per minute and drained at 1 gallon per minute. If the tank starts empty and has a capacity of 100 gallons, how long until it's full?
In a class of 30 students, 18 play soccer, 15 play basketball, and 5 play neither. How many students play both sports?
A car depreciates by 20% each year. If a car is worth $25,000 new, what will it be worth after 3 years?
A baker uses 2.5 cups of flour for every batch of cookies. If she has 17 cups of flour, how many complete batches can she make and how much flour will be left over?
